newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile August supermarket sales rise 5.4 pct.
newsitem.headline: Chile August supermarket sales rise 5.4 pct.

text.p: Chilean supermarket sales grew 5.4 percent last month against August 1995, bringing the increase in the first eight months of the year to nine percent, said trade group Asach.
"This positive growth is in line with Asach's forecast for eight percent growth this year with total sales of $2.97 billion," said the group in a statement.
Supermarket sales are closely watched in Chile as measure of overall consumer spending.
Chileans are among Latin America's most frequent supermarket shoppers with 90 percent of Santiago food shopping carried out in supermarket stores.
